intro: Hieracium lazistanum, commonly known as the Lazistan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium lazistanum is often found in meadows and forest edges, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
